title: Summer 2021 Workshops Announced!
description: Dates and (virtual) locales for the StatPREP 2021 faculty workshops.
contents:
The StatPREP workshops are back after a disruption due to … well you know.
This year, 2021, our workshopes will be held online. Dates are:
Tuesday May XX, 2021 Introductory Workshop and a description of that.
Another day Another Kind of Workshop and a description of that.
Get on our contact list!

title: Components of Data Science
description: What should be in a an early course or two in data science?
contents:
Many StatPREP participants have contacted us with news and questions about data science. The news is typically along these lines:
“I’ve been asked to set up a data-science program at my college.”
“There’s a new state committee on articulation guidelines for data science. I’ve been appointed to it.”
“I’ve been tasked to launch a data-science version of intro stats.”
And the questions are often like these:
What should be in an intro data-science course?
How can I find materials for the new data-science course I’m supposed to launch in the Fall?
Two excellent open resources are the Data Science in a Box site by Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel and an introductory textbook by Chester Ismay and Albert Y. Kim, Modern Dive: Statistical inference via data science.
[Add Components of data science notes here?]
